DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether successful external cephalic version is associated with maternal thyroid function and mood state in pregnant women with breech presentation at term. The relationship between successful external cephalic version and neonatal thyroid function will also be investigated. A possible beneficial effect of successful external cephalic version on the development of congenital hip dysplasia will be evaluated.
DOC.brief_title: EBIS: The Eindhoven Breech Intervention Study
DOC.criteria: Single pregnancy Gestation of 35 weeks or more Appropriate knowledge of the Dutch language Fetus in any of the 4 types of breech presentation: frank breech, complete breech, incomplete breech or footling presentation Previous caesarean section Indication for caesarean delivery irrespective of presentation Previous abruptio placenta Multiple pregnancy Ruptured membranes Nonreassuring fetal monitoring tests results Hyperextended fetal head Significant uterine or fetal anomaly Use of thyroid medication Maternal autoimmune disease (such as insulindependant diabetes mellitus) Intrauterine growth retardation Oligohydramnios HIVpositive women
